sourcesContent:
import {React ,useState} from 'react' import './App.css' function Mealboard() { const [searchType, setSearchType] = useState(''); const [searchCriteria, setSearchCriteria] = useState(''); const [suggestions, setSuggestions] = useState(["test"]); const [meals, setMeals] = useState(""); const [meal_ids, setMeal_ids] = useState(""); function add(e){ setSearchCriteria([...searchCriteria, e]); } function refresh(){ setSearchCriteria(''); setSearchType(''); setMeal_ids(''); setMeals(''); } function send(){ fetch("/getsuggestions", { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', }, body: JSON.stringify( {'searchCritria': searchCriteria,"searchType": searchType }), }).then((response) => response.json()).then((data) => { console.log(data); setSuggestions(data); console.log(suggestions); console.log(Object.entries(data)); for(const [key , value] of Object.entries(data)){ setMeals([...meals, value]); setMeal_ids([...meal_ids, key]); } }); return; } return(

add(e.target.value)} id="ingreds" type="checkbox" value="butter"/> add(e.target.value)} id="ingreds" type="checkbox" value="Flour"/> add(e.target.value)} id="ingreds" type="checkbox" value="onion"/> add(e.target.value)} id="ingreds" type="checkbox" value="Orange"/>

add(e.target.value)} id="ingreds" type="text"/>
